isis.stitle: INSTRUMENTS (Data Link Driven Instrument Cluster) - RE 200 and RE 300 - TROUBLESHOOTING (INDICATOR AND WARNING LIGHT DIAGNOSTICS) - CHECK TRANS

svcsubproc.title: RE 200/RE 300 With Allison WTEC III Transmission With Hydraulic Brakes

table.title: RE 200/RE 300 With Allison WTEC III Transmission With Hydraulic Brakes

entry.para: Disconnect Allison ECU connector (7204) and use a test jumper to connect pin 31, circuit K#115 to ground. Move key switch to ignition position. Does warning light illuminate?
Warning light circuits test good. Turn key off, reconnect conn. (7204), and turn key on. If warning light does not illuminate during bulb check, reprogram/ replace ECU.
Loosen cluster and remove CHECK TRANS warning light bulb. Test for continuity.
Re-install bulb. Go to next step.
Replace defective bulb and reconnect connector. Repeat all tests if problem persists.
Disconnect connector (12), and with jumper still attached at connector (7204), measure resistance from connector (12), pin 7, circuit A125 to ground.

Locate open or poor connection in connector (7204), pin 31, circuit K#115, connector (523), circuit N125, connector (644), circuit A115, connector (377), circuit A125 or connector (12), pin 7, then repair. Reconnect connectors.
Move key switch to ignition position and measure voltage from connector (12), pin 8, circuit A28C to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit A28 or A28C from fuse F22, then repair. Reconnect connectors.
With jumper still installed at connector (7204), reconnect connector (12). Does warning light illuminate?
Warning light circuits test good. Reconnect connector (7204).
Replace defective cluster assembly. Reconnect connector.

svcsubproc.title: RE 200/RE 300 With Allison WTEC III GEN 4 Transmission With Hydraulic Brakes

table.title: RE 200/RE 300 With Allison WTEC III GEN 4 Transmission With Hydraulic Brakes

entry.para: Disconnect Allison ECU connector (7150) and use a test jumper to connect pin 29, circuit K#129 to ground. Move key switch to ignition position. Does warning light illuminate?
Warning light circuits test good. Turn key off, reconnect conn. (7150), and turn key on. If warning light does not illuminate during bulb check, reprogram/ replace ECU.
Loosen cluster and remove CHECK TRANS warning light bulb. Test for continuity.
Re-install bulb. Go to next step.
Replace defective bulb and reconnect connector. Repeat all tests if problem persists.
Disconnect connector (12), and with jumper still attached at connector (7150), measure resistance from connector (12), pin 7, circuit A125 to ground.

Locate open or poor connection in connector (7150), pin 29, circuit K#129, connector (523), circuit N125, connector (644), circuit A115, connector (377), circuit A125 or connector (12), pin 7, then repair. Reconnect connectors.
Move key switch to ignition position and measure voltage from connector (12), pin 8, circuit A28C to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit A28 or A28C from fuse F22, then repair. Reconnect connectors.
With jumper still installed at connector (7150), reconnect connector (12). Does warning light illuminate?
Warning light circuits test good. Reconnect connector (7150).
Replace defective cluster assembly. Reconnect connector.
